citeinfo.title: Catalogue of the Chalcidoidea of the World

descript.abstract: The superfamily Chalcidoidea includes about 26,000 described taxa and is one of the largest groups in the insect order Hymenoptera. Its members have the widest host range of any parasitic insect group, with more than 500 arthropod families and 25 plant families acting as hosts. Through these interactions chalcidoids play a crucial role in the stability of most kinds of terrestrial ecosystems and as natural enemies they may be chosen in preference to the use of pesticides in pest management programmes. This authoritative CD-ROM catalogue by John Noyes of The Natural History Museum, London, provides comprehensive information on taxonomy, distribution, biology and ecology of this important group of insects. It includes 36,000 references, 95,000 host records and 115,000 distributional records as well as over 300 colour images of the adults and immature stages. The TAXA system, developed by Dicky S. Yu of Vancouver, Canada, provides the software engine to look up, search, manipulate and extract data. Biological, distributional and taxonomic information are linked to scientific names which are arranged in an hierarchical taxonomic tree, which provides the framework for listing of all or selected references (alphabetical or chronological) or scientific names (original or valid) at any taxonomic level. Indexes of taxonomic names, common names, authors, images, and references facilitate the search for information, not only for Chalcidoidea, but also for associated organisms in the animal and plant kingdom.
descript.purpose: The purpose is to provide comprehensive information on the Chalidoidea.
descript.supplinf: This information was obtained from the ETI web site - http://www.eti.uva.nl/Products/CD-catalogue.html. (previous geoform was 'CD-ROM catalogue')

cntinfo.cntinst: info@eti.uva.nl - general information about ETI. Phone and fax numbers are for general information. Email adress webmaster@eti.uva.nl may know the most about the online World Biodiversity database.

dataqual.complete: The CD-ROM catalogue provides comprehensive information on taxonomy, distribution, biology and ecology of this Chalcidoidea. It includes 36,000 references, 95,000 host records and 115,000 distributional records as well as over 300 colour images of the adults and immature stages.

overview.eaover: Entity - Chalcidoidea; Attributes - taxonomy, distribution, biology and ecology

distinfo.distliab: ETI is committed to updating its CD-ROM publications in the above mentioned series, including adapting them to hardware configurations and computer operating systems to come (meaning that they will be replaced by new versions when big changes occur). All users of ETI CD-ROM products and the Linnaeus II software can ask for support at our by a helpdesk [support@eti.uva.nl]. We will do our very best to help you with any questions that may arise.

stdorder.ordering: The CD-ROM can be ordered at your local bookshop, and the following distributor(s): Springer Customer Service, Haberstrasse 7, 69126 Heidelberg, Germany; fax: +49 (0) 6221/345 229; e-mail: orders@springer.de; UNESCO Publishing, 7, place de Fontenoy, 75352 Paris 07 SP, France. ETI-partners may order directly at ETI as they receive a discount on the retail prices of all CD's. The Linnaeus II software for Biodiversity Documentation can be purchased only at ETI.

distinfo.techpreq: Windows: Windows 95/98, 486 CPU, 16MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 8x speed CD-ROM or higher; Macintosh: Not available.
